intro: Hieracium flavescens, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along roadsides. It has a taproot system and produces numerous flowering stems that can reach up to 30 centimeters in height. The species is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is considered a common weed in some regions.
